item.title: Tutorial 1
item.description: In this tutorial, we are going to go over the tutorial sheet, which contains 2 questions. The question can be found here. The answer can be found here. For some extra stuff I went over during this tutorial, they can be found here.

item.title: Tutorial 2
item.description: In this tutorial, we’ll go over the quiz Version B that the students wrote last week. Q1 a rnorm(n, mean, sd) round(#, digits) b A, B – cannot tell as it’s a categorical variable C – cannot tell as we can rearrange the order D – True c (I) – False (eyeball) (II) – Recall the relationship between boxplot and histrogram/density plot d Definition [Range]: $$y_{n}-y_{1}.

item.title: Tutorial 3
item.description: In this tutorial, we’ll go over the quiz (Version B) that the students wrote last week. Q1 The solution can be found here. Q2 a & b You may read the following for good references: 1 2 3 c Simply apply the CLT. d Know the formula: $$\bar{y}\pm Z_{pt}\sigma/\sqrt{n}$$. If $n$ increase by 4, then $\sqrt{n}$ will be 2.

item.title: Tutorial 4
item.description: This week (Friday, June 28), I will be teaching two tutorial sections this week (11:30 – 12:20 & 14:30 – 15:20) In this tutorial, we’ll go over the problem. The answer will be posted today. Note: This time, there is only one problem. a. QQ plot for checking Gaussian assumption (p. 80). “A qqplot is a graph for which the expected plot would reasoonably be astraight line plot if the Gaussian model is a good fit.
